programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Semifinal: LSU vs. Virginia Tech
programme.desc: The No. 1 Hokies face the No. 3 Tigers in an NCAA Tournament semifinal. Virginia Tech reached its first Final Four by defeating Ohio State. Kim Mulkey has LSU in the national semifinal for the first time since 2008 in her second season at the helm.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: Second Semifinal: Iowa vs. South Carolina
programme.desc: The No. 2 Hawkeyes play the No. 1 Gamecocks in an NCAA Tournament semifinal. Caitlin Clark posted the first 40-point triple-double in tournament history in Iowa's Elite Eight triumph. South Carolina, the defending champ, has won 42 consecutive games.

programme.title: Lakers @ Timberwolves
programme.sub-title: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: The Timberwolves seek a season-series sweep of the Lakers in this key contest with play-in tournament implications. Los Angeles' D'Angelo Russell and Malik Beasley enter the Target Center as visitors for the first time since a complex Feb. 9 trade.

programme.title: Nuggets @ Suns
programme.desc: The rejuvenated Suns look for a statement win when they host the Nuggets in the desert. Kevin Durant returned for Phoenix on March 29 after missing time with an ankle injury. Denver swept both meetings with Phoenix in Colorado earlier this season.

programme.title: Mavericks @ Heat
programme.desc: Miami faces Dallas in its penultimate regular-season home game. The Mavericks beat the Heat on Jan. 20, and have won their past two at Miami-Dade Arena. Miami's Jimmy Butler is averaging just under 24 points and two steals per home game this season.

programme.title: Mavericks @ Hawks
programme.desc: Luka Doncic and the Mavericks visit Trae Young and the Hawks. Atlanta toppled Dallas 130-122 on Jan. 18 in the all-time highest-scoring matchup between the clubs. Doncic posted 30 points and eight assists, while Young dished out 12 helpers.

programme.title: Suns @ Thunder (Suns Broadcast)
programme.sub-title: Phoenix Suns at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Kevin Durant and the Suns complete their yearly set with the Thunder. Despite being acquired by Phoenix before the season series started, Durant has yet to face Oklahoma City since arriving due to an injury suffered before the March 8 matchup.

programme.title: Spurs @ Warriors (Warriors Broadcast)
programme.sub-title: San Antonio Spurs at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: The Warriors look for one last impressive offensive display versus the Spurs in 2022-23. Golden State averaged 138 points per game against San Antonio in two wins earlier this season. Jordan Poole (GS) led the way with 30.5 ppg on 21-for-36 shooting.
